body_html:
Sure. I agree the name is definitely important however I was saying that having dltensor for now felt better to me since DLManagedTensor needs to be first approved in the core dlpack repo.
…
On Fri, 20 Oct 2017 at 19:09, Zachary DeVito ***@***.***> wrote: ***@***.**** commented on this pull request. ------------------------------ In torch/csrc/Module.cpp <#3207 (comment)>: > @@ -544,12 +544,12 @@ PyObject *THPModule_toDLPack(PyObject *_unused, PyObject *data) THPUtils_assert(THPModule_isTensor(data), "data must be a Tensor"); auto atTensor = torch::createTensor(data); DLManagedTensor* dlMTensor = at::toDLPack(atTensor); - return PyCapsule_New(dlMTensor, "dltensor", NULL); + return PyCapsule_New(dlMTensor, "DLManagedTensor", NULL); The choice of name is significant -- all frameworks that produce or consume the pycapsule need to call it the same thing (if they don't their code will fail to interoperate with this code). So I figure the best name to call it would the C-namespace name of the underlying struct it contains. — You are receiving this because you commented. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <#3207 (comment)>, or mute the thread <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AM3Qk4e6lnBoQL32961MJ-PoWavrkfMmks5suVJIgaJpZM4QBDNk> .
body_text:
Sure. I agree the name is definitely important however I was saying that
having dltensor for now felt better to me since DLManagedTensor needs to be
first approved in the core dlpack repo.
…
On Fri, 20 Oct 2017 at 19:09, Zachary DeVito ***@***.***> wrote:
 ***@***.**** commented on this pull request.
 ------------------------------

 In torch/csrc/Module.cpp
 <#3207 (comment)>:

 > @@ -544,12 +544,12 @@ PyObject *THPModule_toDLPack(PyObject *_unused, PyObject *data)
    THPUtils_assert(THPModule_isTensor(data), "data must be a Tensor");
    auto atTensor = torch::createTensor(data);
    DLManagedTensor* dlMTensor = at::toDLPack(atTensor);
 -  return PyCapsule_New(dlMTensor, "dltensor", NULL);
 +  return PyCapsule_New(dlMTensor, "DLManagedTensor", NULL);

 The choice of name is significant -- all frameworks that produce or
 consume the pycapsule need to call it the same thing (if they don't their
 code will fail to interoperate with this code). So I figure the best name
 to call it would the C-namespace name of the underlying struct it contains.

 —
 You are receiving this because you commented.
 Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
 <#3207 (comment)>, or mute
 the thread
 <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AM3Qk4e6lnBoQL32961MJ-PoWavrkfMmks5suVJIgaJpZM4QBDNk>
 .
body:
Sure. I agree the name is definitely important however I was saying that
having dltensor for now felt better to me since DLManagedTensor needs to be
first approved in the core dlpack repo.


On Fri, 20 Oct 2017 at 19:09, Zachary DeVito <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> *@zdevito* commented on this pull request.
> ------------------------------
>
> In torch/csrc/Module.cpp
> <https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/pull/3207#discussion_r146093880>:
>
> > @@ -544,12 +544,12 @@ PyObject *THPModule_toDLPack(PyObject *_unused, PyObject *data)
>    THPUtils_assert(THPModule_isTensor(data), "data must be a Tensor");
>    auto atTensor = torch::createTensor(data);
>    DLManagedTensor* dlMTensor = at::toDLPack(atTensor);
> -  return PyCapsule_New(dlMTensor, "dltensor", NULL);
> +  return PyCapsule_New(dlMTensor, "DLManagedTensor", NULL);
>
> The choice of name is significant -- all frameworks that produce or
> consume the pycapsule need to call it the same thing (if they don't their
> code will fail to interoperate with this code). So I figure the best name
> to call it would the C-namespace name of the underlying struct it contains.
>
